Miscellaneous Highlights: England’s first T20 against Pakistan on May 22, 2024, was abandoned due to rain.
The match was scheduled to be held at Headingley, Leeds.
Heavy rainfall throughout the day caused the abandonment without a ball being bowled.
The region was hit by an amber weather warning from the Met Office.
The decision to call off the game was made at 5.30pm due to standing water on the outfield.
Jofra Archer missed out on crucial game time to prove his fitness after a lengthy injury lay-off.
The four-match series is set to continue at Edgbaston on Saturday, followed by games in Cardiff and at the Oval.
England begin their T20 World Cup campaign against Scotland on June 4, 2024.
